item.title: Doris add a quote by Truman Capote
item.description: "Failure is the condiment that gives success its flavor." -- Truman Capote

item.title: Doris add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "And, when you want something, all the universe conspires in helping you to achieve it." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: Doris add a quote by J.D. Stroube
item.description: "No one has free will until they are an adult, and by then the choices that were made for them, have already set them on a course that gives limited freedom in the choices to be made." -- J.D. Stroube

item.title: Doris add a quote by James Rollins
item.description: "Gray imagined Kat scolding her husband in an operatic duet that has been going on between husbands and wives for ages, that eternal mix of exasperation and love." -- James Rollins" -- James Rollins

item.title: Doris add a quote by Katharine Hepburn
item.description: "If you obey all of the rules, you miss all of the fun." -- Katharine Hepburn

item.title: Doris add a quote by Robertson Davies
item.description: "Authors like cats because they are such quiet, lovable, wise creatures, and cats like authors for the same reasons." -- Robertson Davies

item.title: Doris add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Second hand books are wild books, homeless books; they have come together in vast flocks of variegated feather, and have a charm which the domesticated volumes of the library lack." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Doris add a quote by Edward Lear
item.description: "The Owl and the Pussy-cat went to sea In a beautiful pea green boat..." -- Edward Lear
